Description: Amulet in glazed composition in the shape of rectangular (?) plaque; decorated with right wedjat-eye, roughly incised on the top of plaque; convex back very damaged, possibly undecorated; pierced lengthways for suspension; most of the pale turquoise glaze is worn, except a few patches here and there; pale cream core; incisions filled with dark brown earth.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by World Museum, Liverpool. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OK.330) (phase 3)
Condition: Poor, surface very damaged and glaze mostly worn
Previous owner: Currently owned by: World Museum, Liverpool
